result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th) and OWI (5th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th) and the other charge, OWI (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kevyn J. Karch was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).
  • Kevyn J. Karch was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

miscConds.notes: Fine and Costs are to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
See Comments noted above for the Fine.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.    Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any sentence existing at the time this sentence may be served.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.    Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevyn J. Karch

defendant.name: Karch, Kevyn J.

records.addlTxt: for IID Exemptions - Granted by the Court

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:35 PM: Defendant Kevyn J. Karch in court with attorney Thomas Peter Chalchoff.  Defendant Kevyn J. Karch in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Argument by ADA.  Argument by Atty Chalchoff.  Statement by Def: Yes.   ADA offers Stipulation as to TS credit of 31 days - Atty Chalchoff calculates 32 days TS credit.  The Court:   S/W - 30 mos probation.  Ct 2: 8 mos WCJ, Huber and GT, 32 days TS credit - approx 5 mos left to serve. Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru;   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; 36 mos DL Rev/IID; Def is strongly encouraged to obtain OCC DL as soon as eligible due to term of IID - Rev period cannot be sat out; $3000 Fine - no bond to be applied - 60 DTP or PP;  DNA Sample and Surcharge Assessed.  Right to petition for expungement thru DOJ explained. Ct 3:  30 days WCJ - consecutive to any sentence existing at the time this sent is served - imposed and stayed - S/W - 1 yr probation.  Same conditions ordered as to Ct 2 but for the WC Jail time.  Separate period of probation term.  DNA Surcharge and Sample also ordered. Appeal Rights Given.  $38.89 witness fee ordered.  As to both Counts - participation and completion of TAD program.
Exhibits #1-23 (Exhibits #11 & 21-CD's-unable to be scanned). Exhibit stored in vault, far right corner.

8:34 am case called. Defendant Kevyn J. Karch in court with attorney Thomas Peter Chalchoff.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Exhibit #1 offered and received. Court grants officer for State. Court questions Attorney Chalchoff re: sequestration. Atty Chalchoff requests sequestration and same is granted by the Court.  State's Court officer with be Sgt Gunderson.  Stipulations recited:  911 Call will brought in by Maxine Ferron, Dispatcher will not testify.  Stipulating to blood draw, hospital tech will not testify and results will brought in by analyst testimony.  Atty Chalchoff confirms Stip on blood draw with the understanding that Deputy Gunderson did observe the blood draw.  Final Stip - counsel stipulate as to analyst testimony either by video or phone.  Discussion regarding rules of evidence and 906.09 evidence.  8:45am State calls Sgt. Zachary Gunderson, witness sworn, testimony given. Exhibit #2, #4, #5, #6, #8, #9, #10,#11 offered and received. 8:53 am-Positive identification of defendant in court. 9:34 am Cross exam by Attorney Chalchoff, testimony given. Exhbiti #12, #13, #14, #15, #16, #17, #18, #19 offered and received. 10:13 am Re-direct by State-testimony given. 10:15 am Re-Cross by Attorney Chalchoff-testimony given. 10:18 am court recesses. 10:34 am case recalled. Same appearances. State calls Deputy Wes Bowser, witness sworn, testimony given. Exhibit #20 offered and received10:50 am Cross exam by Attorney Chalchoff-testimony given. 11:21 Re-direct by State. 11:25 am Winess excused. State calls Maxine Ferron, witness sworn, testimony given. Exhibit #21 offered and received. Cross exam by Attorney Chalchoff. Lorrine Edwards, witness sworn, testimony given. Exhibit #22 & #7. 12:00 pm court recesses. 1:00 pm Court reconvenese, same appearances. Court questions Attorney Chalchoff regarding motion. None to be made. Court makes a statement regarding order and evidence put forth to this point.  Court enters an order regarding burden of proof. 1:04 pm the court admonishes the defendant regarding his 5th & 6th amendment rights. 1:06 pm Attorney Chalchoff calls Kevyn J. Karch, witness sworn, testimony given. Cross exam by State. Re-direct by Attorney Chalchoff. Re-Cross by State. 1:51 pm Attorney Chalchoff calls Jerome R. Karch, witness sworn, testimony given. Exhibit #23 offered and received. Cross exam by State. 2:22 pm Defense rests. 2:25 pm court recesses. 2:40 pm Court recalls case-same appearances. Argument by Attorney Anderson. Argument by Attorney Chalchoff. Court makes statement and finds it has been proven that the defendant beyond a reasonable doubt had operated a motor vehicle under the influence on a Highway for the 5th time since 1989,  drug paraphernalia charge proven beyond a reasonable doubt, and beyond a reasonable doubt for PAC above .02. Court dismisses Count 1 outright. Court enters JOC to Counts 2 & 3.  Court discusses TAD court with defendant. Court revokes bond and remands the defendant to the jail.

1:08 pm case called. Defendant Kevyn J. Karch in court with attorney Thomas Peter Chalchoff.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court goes over motion in limine filed by the District Attorney. Statement by Attorney Chalchoff regarding jury instructions-no objection. Further statement regarding other motions in limine-does not object. Court grants all motions in limine with the exeption of paragraph 10-906.09 motions. Court makes statement regarding 906.09 motion filed by the State and makes a preliminary ruling regarding 906.09 motion. Court instructs the defendant regarding testimony and answer to criminal offenses-6. Old Chief stipulation entered on the record and Court accepts. Statement by Attorney Chalchoff-defendant is wishing to waive his right to a jury trial and requests the matter to be tried before the court. Court makes a statement to parties regarding HGN & testimony. Court questions defendant regarding waiver to jury trial. Court accepts waiver of right to jury trial and matter will now be a trial to the court. Further discussion between counsel and court. Rejection of offer discussed with defendant-Court accepts rejection of offer to defendant by State. Court makes a statement to defendant regarding plea offer.  Court trial scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
State's Documentation in Support of HGN
State's Motion to Impeach with Prior Convictions

Final pre-trial at 01-05-2016 10:00 am.
Jury trial at 02-04-2016 08:00 am.

10:20 am case called. Defendant Kevyn J. Karch in court with attorney Thomas Peter Chalchoff.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Chalcoff confirms waiver of preliminary hearing and right to preliminary hearing. Attorney Chalchoff provides court with waiver of preliminary hearing form. Court questions defendant regrding waiver of preliminary hearing and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaint and finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial of said charges. Information files. Attorney Chalchoff confirms receipt and waives formal reading-enters plea of Not Guilty to all counts-requests jury trial be scheduled. Discussion between court and counsel regarding motions, etc. 5 strikes per party, impanel 1 provisional juror-23 in box. Court makes statement regarding "Old Chief" stipulation.  Jury trial scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Thomas Peter Chalchoff in court appear telephonically.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Chalchoff is requesting an arraignment and waiver of preliminary hearing. Atty Chalchoff believes that a trial will be necessary. Jury Trial to be scheduled at the next hearing.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 10:15 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:18 p.m. Defendant Kevyn J. Karch in court with attorney Thomas Peter Chalchoff.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. Court orders $5000 Sig Bond.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 02:55 pm.
